items.title: Journalists in Gaza protest Israel’s killing of their colleagues

items.content: A group of Palestinian journalists gathered to protest Israel’s killing of their colleagues at Nasser hospital.

items.title: Gaza hospital rejects Israel's claim troops 'saw Hamas camera' before deadly attack
items.standfirst: A hospital in Gaza that was hit in an Israeli strike, killing 20 people including five journalists, has rejected the Israeli military's claim it struck the facility because it was targeting what it believed was a Hamas surveillance camera as well as people identified as militants.
items.content: A hospital in Gaza that was hit in an Israeli strike, killing 20 people including five journalists, has rejected the Israeli military's claim it struck the facility because it was targeting what it believed was a Hamas surveillance camera as well as people identified as militants.

items.title: UN demands justice over Israeli double strike on Gaza hospital
items.standfirst: An initial Israeli military report says the attack targeted a "Hamas camera" and identified "gaps" for further investigation.
items.content: An initial Israeli military report says the attack targeted a "Hamas camera" and identified "gaps" for further investigation.

items.title: Gaza: Israel strikes hospital, killing five journalists
items.standfirst: Israel struck one of the main hospitals in the Gaza Strip on Monday and then hit the facility again as journalists and rescue workers rushed to the scene, killing at least 20 people and wounding scores more, local health workers said.
items.content: Israel struck one of the main hospitals in the Gaza Strip on Monday and then hit the facility again as journalists and rescue workers rushed to the scene, killing at least 20 people and wounding scores more, local health workers said.

items.title: Who were the five journalists killed in Israel’s Gaza hospital attack?
items.standfirst: Israel killed five journalists when it attacked Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis on Monday using a ‘double-tap’ attack.
items.content: Israel killed five journalists when it attacked Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis on Monday using a ‘double-tap’ attack.

items.title: Five journalists among 20 killed in Israeli double strike on hospital
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said it was a "tragic mishap" and promised a "thorough investigation".
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said it was a "tragic mishap" and promised a "thorough investigation".

items.title: Video shows aftermath of deadly Israeli airstrike near Gaza hospital
items.standfirst: An Israeli airstrike near the Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis, Gaza, has killed at least 19 people, including journalists, according to the hospital. The IDF released a statement that said: "The IDF regrets any harm to uninvolved individuals and does not target journalists as such."
items.content: An Israeli airstrike near the Nasser Hospital in Khan Younis, Gaza, has killed at least 19 people, including journalists, according to the hospital. The IDF released a statement that said: "The IDF regrets any harm to uninvolved individuals and does not target journalists as such."

items.title: Five journalists among 20 killed in Israeli strikes on hospital, Gaza health ministry says
items.standfirst: Israeli strikes on a hospital in southern Gaza have killed at least 20 people, including five journalists, according to the Gaza health ministry and the media organisations the journalists worked for.
items.content: Israeli strikes on a hospital in southern Gaza have killed at least 20 people, including five journalists, according to the Gaza health ministry and the media organisations the journalists worked for.

clusters.title: 8/26: CBS Morning News
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump's Attempt to Fire Fed Governor Lisa Cook

items.title: 8/26: CBS Morning News
items.standfirst: President Trump says he has fired Federal Reserve board member Lisa Cook; FEMA staff publish letter warning about cuts to agency.
items.content: President Trump says he has fired Federal Reserve board member Lisa Cook; FEMA staff publish letter warning about cuts to agency.

items.title: Questions about Trump's authority to fire Fed Gov. Lisa Cook
items.standfirst: President Trump has taken his fight with the Federal Reserve to another level, demanding the removal of one of the Central Bank's governors. Overnight, Trump posted an apparent termination letter online, saying that he removed Lisa Cook over allegations that she committed mortgage fraud. But there are questions about Mr. Trump's authority to remove Cook. CBS News' Aaron Navarro and Jo Ling Kent break the situation down.
items.content: President Trump has taken his fight with the Federal Reserve to another level, demanding the removal of one of the Central Bank's governors. Overnight, Trump posted an apparent termination letter online, saying that he removed Lisa Cook over allegations that she committed mortgage fraud. But there are questions about Mr. Trump's authority to remove Cook. CBS News' Aaron Navarro and Jo Ling Kent break the situation down.

items.title: Lisa Cook says she won't resign from Federal Reserve Board after Trump moves to fire her

CBS News White House reporter Aaron Navarro has the latest. Then, Abha Bhattarai, economics correspondent for The Washington Post, and Tom Dupree, former deputy assistant attorney general, join with analysis.

Trump's comment at a Cabinet meeting came hours after he took the unprecedented step of moving to fire central bank…
items.content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday he will soon have a "majority" of his own nominees on the Federal Reserve board of governors who will back his desire to slash interest rates. Trump's comment at a Cabinet meeting came hours after he took the unprecedented step of moving to fire central bank…

items.title: Fed governor Lisa Cook vows not tostep down, saying Trump lacks authority to fire her
items.standfirst: Financial markets worldwide have been rattled by President Donald Trump's announcement that he's firing Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, an unprecedented move and sharp escalation in his effort to exert greater control over what has long been considered an institution independent from day-to-day politics. But Cook said she's not leaving: “President Trump purported to fire me ‘for cause’ when no cause exists under the law, and he has no authority to do so,” she said in an emailed statement. “I will not resign.” Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs commentator, Douglas Herbert.
items.content: Financial markets worldwide have been rattled by President Donald Trump's announcement that he's firing Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook, an unprecedented move and sharp escalation in his effort to exert greater control over what has long been considered an institution independent from day-to-day politics. But Cook said she's not leaving: “President Trump purported to fire me ‘for cause’ when no cause exists under the law, and he has no authority to do so,” she said in an emailed statement. “I will not resign.” Analysis by FRANCE 24 international affairs commentator, Douglas Herbert.

items.title: Trump says he hopes to meet Kim Jong-un and raises prospect of US taking over some South Korean land
items.standfirst: South Korean president Lee Jae Myung uses Oval Office meeting to encourage Trump to engage with North Korean leaderDonald Trump has said he wants to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, possibly this year, in an attempt to revive the failed nuclear diplomacy of his first term as US president.“I’d like to have a meeting. I look forward to meeting with Kim Jong-un in the appropriate future,” Trump said during an occasionally awkward meeting at the Oval Office with South Korea’s new president, Lee Jae Myung, in which he raised the prospect of taking ownership of South Korean land that hosts a US military base. items.title: Judge tosses Justice Department lawsuit against Maryland's federal judges over immigration order
items.standfirst: A judge has dismissed a Justice Department lawsuit against all 15 of Maryland's federal judges, delivering a legal blow to the Trump administration. The lawsuit stemmed from an order that blocked federal immigration officials from immediately removing migrants who challenged their detention status. CBS News legal contributor Jessica Levinson has more on the case.

clusters.title: Trump administration pulls another $175m from California’s high-speed rail
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Administration Cuts Funding for California Rail

items.title: Trump administration pulls another $175m from California’s high-speed rail
items.standfirst: Move follows cancellation earlier this summer of $4bn in federal grants for state’s ambitious but long-overdue planThe Trump administration is cancelling another $175m in funding for California’s high-speed rail, marking another setback for the state’s much-delayed project.The US transportation department said on Tuesday it was withdrawing funding the $175m for grade separation, over-crossing and design work and to build a high-speed rail station in Madera. The move follows the cancellation earlier this summer of $4bn in federal grants for the state’s ambitious but long-overdue plans. Continue reading...
items.content: Move follows cancellation earlier this summer of $4bn in federal grants for state’s ambitious but long-overdue planThe Trump administration is cancelling another $175m in funding for California’s high-speed rail, marking another setback for the state’s much-delayed project.The US transportation department said on Tuesday it was withdrawing funding the $175m for grade separation, over-crossing and design work and to build a high-speed rail station in Madera. The move follows the cancellation earlier this summer of $4bn in federal grants for the state’s ambitious but long-overdue plans. Continue reading...

clusters.title: First human case of flesh-eating screwworm parasite confirmed in US
clusters.neutral_headline: First Human Case of Flesh-Eating Parasite in US

items.title: First human case of flesh-eating screwworm parasite confirmed in US
items.standfirst: New World screwworm myiasis was found in a patient who returned to the US from El Salvador, authorities say.
items.content: New World screwworm myiasis was found in a patient who returned to the US from El Salvador, authorities say.

items.title: First human case of flesh-eating screwworm parasite confirmed in US
items.standfirst: HHS told Reuters patient had returned from El Salvador but beef industry said person had traveled from GuatemalaThe US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) on Sunday reported the first human case in the US of travel-associated New World screwworm, a flesh-eating parasite, from an outbreak-affected country.The case, investigated by the Maryland department of health and the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), was confirmed by the CDC as New World screwworm on 4 August – and involved a patient who returned from travel to El Salvador, an HHS spokesperson, Andrew G Nixon, said in an email to Reuters. Continue reading...
items.content: HHS told Reuters patient had returned from El Salvador but beef industry said person had traveled from GuatemalaThe US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) on Sunday reported the first human case in the US of travel-associated New World screwworm, a flesh-eating parasite, from an outbreak-affected country.The case, investigated by the Maryland department of health and the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), was confirmed by the CDC as New World screwworm on 4 August – and involved a patient who returned from travel to El Salvador, an HHS spokesperson, Andrew G Nixon, said in an email to Reuters. Continue reading...

items.title: First human case of flesh-eating screwworm parasite detected in the U.S.

items.content: The first human case of the flesh-eating parasite "New World screwworm "has been detected in the United States, the Department of Health and Human Services said early Monday

items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said Tuesday (Aug. 26) that Meta plans to spend $50 billion on the Hyperion data center it is building in Louisiana. Trump said this during a Cabinet meeting and held up a graphic that he said was given to him by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, showing the scale of the…
items.content: President Donald Trump said Tuesday (Aug. 26) that Meta plans to spend $50 billion on the Hyperion data center it is building in Louisiana. Trump said this during a Cabinet meeting and held up a graphic that he said was given to him by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, showing the scale of the…

items.title: Meta’s Louisiana Data Center to Cost $50 Billion, Trump Says
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump said that Meta Platforms Inc. is planning to spend $50 billion on its massive data center in rural Louisiana.
items.content: President Donald Trump said that Meta Platforms Inc. is planning to spend $50 billion on its massive data center in rural Louisiana.

ai_summary: Trump said Meta will spend $50 billion on a Louisiana data center.
The data center is the Hyperion data center.
Trump made the statement during a Cabinet meeting.
Trump showed a graphic from Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg.
The data center is in rural Louisiana.

clusters.title: France hands back human remains to Madagascar 127 years after colonial massacre
clusters.neutral_headline: France Returns Skulls to Madagascar After Colonial Era

items.title: France hands back human remains to Madagascar 127 years after colonial massacre
items.standfirst: France has formally returned 3 colonial-era skulls to Madagscar -- one of which is believed to belong to a Malagasy king who was beheaded by French troops during a massacre in 1897.His skull then taken back to Paris as a trophy, and placed in the archives of the Natural History Museum. It's the first restitution of human remains since France passed a law to facilitate their return two years ago.
items.content: France has formally returned 3 colonial-era skulls to Madagscar -- one of which is believed to belong to a Malagasy king who was beheaded by French troops during a massacre in 1897.His skull then taken back to Paris as a trophy, and placed in the archives of the Natural History Museum. It's the first restitution of human remains since France passed a law to facilitate their return two years ago.

items.title: France returns three skulls to Madagascar, a former colony
items.standfirst: France returned three colonial-era skulls to Madagascar, including one believed to be a Malagasy king beheaded by French troops during a 19th-century massacre. Story by Antonia Kerrigan and Jules Boiteau.
items.content: France returned three colonial-era skulls to Madagascar, including one believed to be a Malagasy king beheaded by French troops during a 19th-century massacre. Story by Antonia Kerrigan and Jules Boiteau.

items.title: France returns slain king's skull to Madagascar
items.standfirst: King Toera was killed by French troops 128 years ago and his head kept in a Paris museum's archive.
items.content: King Toera was killed by French troops 128 years ago and his head kept in a Paris museum's archive.

ai_summary: France returned three skulls to Madagascar, including one believed to be a king's.
The king was beheaded by French troops during a massacre in 1897.
His skull was taken to Paris and placed in the Natural History Museum archives.
This restitution is the first since France passed a law to facilitate returns.
The law was passed two years prior to the return of the skulls.

clusters.title: Cracker Barrel apologizes for new logo but says it is sticking with change
clusters.neutral_headline: Cracker Barrel Apologizes for Logo Change, Sticking with It

items.title: Cracker Barrel apologizes for new logo but says it is sticking with change
items.standfirst: The US restaurant chain Cracker Barrel has apologized to fans who were angered when it announced a new logo recently – but it is sticking with the change. “If the last few days have shown us anything, it’s how deeply people care about Cracker Barrel. We’re truly grateful for your heartfelt…
items.content: The US restaurant chain Cracker Barrel has apologized to fans who were angered when it announced a new logo recently – but it is sticking with the change. “If the last few days have shown us anything, it’s how deeply people care about Cracker Barrel. We’re truly grateful for your heartfelt…

items.title: Cracker Barrel apologizes for new logo but says it is sticking with change
items.standfirst: Company says ‘we could have done a better job sharing who we are’ after taking heat over rebrandThe US restaurant chain Cracker Barrel has apologized to fans who were angered when it announced a new logo recently – but it is sticking with the change.“If the last few days have shown us anything, it’s how deeply people care about Cracker Barrel. We’re truly grateful for your heartfelt voices,” the company said Monday in a statement on its website. “You’ve also shown us that we could have done a better job sharing who we are and who we’ll always be.” Continue reading...
items.content: Company says ‘we could have done a better job sharing who we are’ after taking heat over rebrandThe US restaurant chain Cracker Barrel has apologized to fans who were angered when it announced a new logo recently – but it is sticking with the change.“If the last few days have shown us anything, it’s how deeply people care about Cracker Barrel. We’re truly grateful for your heartfelt voices,” the company said Monday in a statement on its website. “You’ve also shown us that we could have done a better job sharing who we are and who we’ll always be.” Continue reading...

ai_summary: Cracker Barrel apologized for the new logo after fan backlash.
The company stated they understood the public's care for the brand.
They acknowledged they could have better communicated the changes.
The company is still moving forward with the new logo design.
The logo change was announced recently, causing immediate reaction.

clusters.title: At least 34 soldiers kidnapped in Colombia after operation against FARC dissidents
clusters.neutral_headline: 34 Soldiers Kidnapped in Colombia After FARC Operation

items.title: At least 34 soldiers kidnapped in Colombia after operation against FARC dissidents
items.standfirst: At least 34 soldiers were kidnapped by armed civilians in a jungle area of southeastern Colombia as they were evacuating after a military operation against members of a dissident faction of the former FARC rebel group, Colombia’s Defense Minister Pedro Sanchez said Tuesday.
items.content: At least 34 soldiers were kidnapped by armed civilians in a jungle area of southeastern Colombia as they were evacuating after a military operation against members of a dissident faction of the former FARC rebel group, Colombia’s Defense Minister Pedro Sanchez said Tuesday.

items.title: At least 34 Colombian soldiers kidnapped after clashes with FARC dissidents
items.standfirst: Defence minister says soldiers taken while evacuating area after a military operation that killed 11 rebels.
items.content: Defence minister says soldiers taken while evacuating area after a military operation that killed 11 rebels.

ai_summary: At least 34 Colombian soldiers were kidnapped in a jungle area.
The soldiers were evacuating after a military operation.
The operation targeted a dissident faction of the FARC rebel group.
The Defense Minister confirmed the kidnapping incident.
The clashes resulted in the death of eleven rebels.

clusters.title: Teenager convicted over IS-inspired plot to attack Taylor Swift concert
clusters.neutral_headline: Teenager convicted over IS-inspired plot to attack Taylor Swift concert

items.title: Teenager convicted over IS-inspired plot to attack Taylor Swift concert
items.standfirst: Mohammad A, 16, given 18-month suspended sentence for helping plan foiled attack in ViennaA Berlin court has convicted a Syrian teenager of contributing to an Islamic State-inspired plot to attack a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna.Three dates in the US pop star’s record-breaking Eras tour were cancelled last summer after authorities learned of the plot. Continue reading...
items.content: Mohammad A, 16, given 18-month suspended sentence for helping plan foiled attack in ViennaA Berlin court has convicted a Syrian teenager of contributing to an Islamic State-inspired plot to attack a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna.Three dates in the US pop star’s record-breaking Eras tour were cancelled last summer after authorities learned of the plot. Continue reading...

items.title: Teen avoids jail over plot to attack Taylor Swift Vienna concert
items.standfirst: Mohamed A will serve an 18-month suspended sentence after sending bomb-making instructions.
items.content: Mohamed A will serve an 18-month suspended sentence after sending bomb-making instructions.

ai_summary: A Syrian teenager was convicted in Berlin for the plot.
The plot was inspired by the Islamic State group.
The plot aimed to attack a Taylor Swift concert in Vienna.
Authorities learned of the plot before the concert.
Three dates of the Eras tour were canceled due to the plot.

clusters.title: Artwork looted by Nazis 80 years ago spotted in estate agent ad
clusters.neutral_headline: Artwork looted by Nazis 80 years ago spotted in estate agent ad

items.title: Artwork looted by Nazis 80 years ago spotted in estate agent ad
items.standfirst: Portrait of a Lady seen in house near Buenos Aires, more than 80 years after it was looted from a Jewish art dealer in Amsterdam.
items.content: Portrait of a Lady seen in house near Buenos Aires, more than 80 years after it was looted from a Jewish art dealer in Amsterdam.

items.title: Old master painting looted by Nazis spotted in Argentinian property listing
items.standfirst: Dutch newspaper AD says it has traced Giuseppe Ghislandi’s Portrait of a Lady to house near Buenos AiresMore than 80 years after it was looted by the Nazis from a Jewish art dealer in Amsterdam, a portrait by an Italian master has been spotted on the website of an estate agent advertising a house for sale in Argentina.A photo shows the painting, Portrait of a Lady (Contessa Colleoni) by the late-baroque portraitist Giuseppe Ghislandi, also known as Fra’ Galgario, hanging above a sofa in the living room of the property, in a seaside town near Buenos Aires. Continue reading...
items.content: Dutch newspaper AD says it has traced Giuseppe Ghislandi’s Portrait of a Lady to house near Buenos AiresMore than 80 years after it was looted by the Nazis from a Jewish art dealer in Amsterdam, a portrait by an Italian master has been spotted on the website of an estate agent advertising a house for sale in Argentina.A photo shows the painting, Portrait of a Lady (Contessa Colleoni) by the late-baroque portraitist Giuseppe Ghislandi, also known as Fra’ Galgario, hanging above a sofa in the living room of the property, in a seaside town near Buenos Aires. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A painting looted by Nazis was found in an Argentinian listing.
The painting is a portrait by Giuseppe Ghislandi.
The painting was looted from a Jewish art dealer in Amsterdam.
The painting was found in a house near Buenos Aires.
The painting is titled Portrait of a Lady (Contessa Colleoni).

clusters.title: Ukraine admits Russia has entered key region of Dnipropetrovsk
clusters.neutral_headline: Ukraine Admits Russian Forces Entered Dnipropetrovsk Region

items.title: Ukraine admits Russia has entered key region of Dnipropetrovsk
items.standfirst: Military says Russian advance "is the first attack of such a large scale" in industrial province.
items.content: Military says Russian advance "is the first attack of such a large scale" in industrial province.

items.title: Ukraine admits Russian army has entered central Dnipropetrovsk region, fighting ongoing
items.standfirst: Ukraine admitted for the first time on Tuesday that Russian forces had entered the central Dnipropetrovsk region, saying fighting there was ongoing. The battlefield monitor DeepState said in a social media post that the Russian army was “consolidating its positions” and preparing “for a further advance”.
items.content: Ukraine admitted for the first time on Tuesday that Russian forces had entered the central Dnipropetrovsk region, saying fighting there was ongoing. The battlefield monitor DeepState said in a social media post that the Russian army was “consolidating its positions” and preparing “for a further advance”.

ai_summary: Ukraine admitted Russian forces entered the Dnipropetrovsk region.
Fighting is ongoing in the central Dnipropetrovsk region.
The Russian advance is of a large scale, according to Ukraine.
DeepState reported the Russian army consolidating positions.
The Russian army is preparing for further advance, according to DeepState.

clusters.title: US envoy tells Arab journalists in Lebanon to ‘be civilised’
clusters.neutral_headline: US envoy sparks uproar after telling Lebanese journalists to ‘act civilised’

items.title: US envoy tells Arab journalists in Lebanon to ‘be civilised’
items.standfirst: US envoy Thomas Barrack sparked outrage in Beirut after telling Arab journalists to act “civilised,” not “animalistic."
items.content: US envoy Thomas Barrack sparked outrage in Beirut after telling Arab journalists to act “civilised,” not “animalistic."

items.title: US envoy sparks uproar after telling Lebanese journalists to ‘act civilised’
items.standfirst: Reporters demand apology from Tom Barrack, US special envoy to Syria, after his remarks at Beirut press conference Journalists in Lebanon have demanded an apology from a senior US envoy after he told them to “act civilized” and not be “animalistic”.As reporters shouted questions after the US delegation’s meeting with the Lebanese president, Joseph Aoun, on Tuesday, Tom Barrack, the US ambassador to Turkey and special envoy to Syria, stepped up to the podium in the packed room and said: “We’re going to have a different set of rules ... please be quiet for a moment. Continue reading...
items.content: Reporters demand apology from Tom Barrack, US special envoy to Syria, after his remarks at Beirut press conference Journalists in Lebanon have demanded an apology from a senior US envoy after he told them to “act civilized” and not be “animalistic”.As reporters shouted questions after the US delegation’s meeting with the Lebanese president, Joseph Aoun, on Tuesday, Tom Barrack, the US ambassador to Turkey and special envoy to Syria, stepped up to the podium in the packed room and said: “We’re going to have a different set of rules ... please be quiet for a moment. Continue reading...

ai_summary: A US envoy told Lebanese journalists to "act civilized".
The envoy is Tom Barrack, the US special envoy to Syria.
Journalists demanded an apology for the remarks.
The remarks were made at a press conference in Beirut.
Barrack told the journalists not to be "animalistic".

clusters.title: Macron hits back at Netanyahu over ‘murderous’ Gaza war

items.title: Macron hits back at Netanyahu over ‘murderous’ Gaza war
items.standfirst: French president rejects Israeli prime minister’s accusations that France is fuelling antisemitism
items.content: French president rejects Israeli prime minister’s accusations that France is fuelling antisemitism

items.title: Macron warns Netanyahu fight against anti-Semitism must not be 'weaponised'
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron strongly rejected Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s recent criticism over rising anti-Semitism in France and warned the issue should not be “weaponised” in a letter to the Israeli leader published Tuesday.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron strongly rejected Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s recent criticism over rising anti-Semitism in France and warned the issue should not be “weaponised” in a letter to the Israeli leader published Tuesday.

items.title: Macron warns Netanyahu that fight against anti-Semitism must not be 'weaponised'

ai_summary: Macron rejected Netanyahu's criticism of antisemitism in France.
Macron warned against weaponizing the issue of antisemitism.
The warning was made in a letter to the Israeli leader.
Netanyahu had criticized France over rising antisemitism.
The letter was published on Tuesday.

clusters.title: Lebanon to present Hezbollah disarmament plan in coming days: US envoy
clusters.neutral_headline: Lebanon to propose Hezbollah disarmament plan on August 31, Israel to give counterproposal

items.title: Lebanon to present Hezbollah disarmament plan in coming days: US envoy
items.standfirst: Tom Barrack says Beirut will set out plan on Sunday. Hezbollah has rejected it as Israel continues attacks.
items.content: Tom Barrack says Beirut will set out plan on Sunday. Hezbollah has rejected it as Israel continues attacks.

items.title: Hezbollah chief rejects disarmament, Lebanon to submit new plan by the end of the week
items.standfirst: On Monday, Israel signalled it would scale back its military presence in southern Lebanon if the Lebanese armed forces took action to disarm Shi'ite militant group Hezbollah, while the Iran-backed group reiterated its refusal to lay down its weapons. Lebanon then stated that it would present a plan aimed at persuading Hezbollah to disarm, with Israel expected to submit a corresponding framework for its military withdrawal, top U.S. envoy Thomas Barrack. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Beiruty, Rawad Taha.
items.content: On Monday, Israel signalled it would scale back its military presence in southern Lebanon if the Lebanese armed forces took action to disarm Shi'ite militant group Hezbollah, while the Iran-backed group reiterated its refusal to lay down its weapons. Lebanon then stated that it would present a plan aimed at persuading Hezbollah to disarm, with Israel expected to submit a corresponding framework for its military withdrawal, top U.S. envoy Thomas Barrack. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Beiruty, Rawad Taha.

items.title: Lebanon to propose Hezbollah disarmament plan on August 31, Israel to give counterproposal
items.standfirst: Lebanon will present a plan on Sunday aimed at persuading Hezbollah to disarm, with Israel expected to submit a corresponding framework for its military withdrawal, top U.S. envoy Thomas Barrack said on Tuesday. Story by Emerald Maxwell.
items.content: Lebanon will present a plan on Sunday aimed at persuading Hezbollah to disarm, with Israel expected to submit a corresponding framework for its military withdrawal, top U.S. envoy Thomas Barrack said on Tuesday. Story by Emerald Maxwell.

ai_summary: Lebanon will present a plan to disarm Hezbollah on August 31.
Israel is expected to submit a framework for military withdrawal.
The US envoy, Thomas Barrack, confirmed the plan.
Hezbollah has rejected the disarmament plan.
Israel signaled it would scale back presence if Hezbollah disarms.

clusters.title: France summons U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner over antisemitism claims
clusters.neutral_headline: France summons US envoy over antisemitism claims

items.title: France summons U.S. Ambassador Charles Kushner over antisemitism claims
items.standfirst: France has summoned the American ambassador to Paris after he wrote a letter to President Emmanuel Macron alleging that the country had not taken “sufficient action” to combat antisemitism.
items.content: France has summoned the American ambassador to Paris after he wrote a letter to President Emmanuel Macron alleging that the country had not taken “sufficient action” to combat antisemitism.

items.title: France summons US envoy over antisemitism claims
items.standfirst: France denies allegations it is failing to tackle a surge in antisemitism since the Gaza war began.
items.content: France denies allegations it is failing to tackle a surge in antisemitism since the Gaza war began.

ai_summary: France summoned the US ambassador to Paris.
The summons followed a letter to President Macron.
The letter alleged insufficient action against antisemitism.
The letter was written by the American ambassador.
France denies the allegations of failing to combat antisemitism.
